definitions.text: the inside lower horizontal surface (as of a room, hallway, tent, or other structure)
examples: they needed rugs to cover the bare floors
we spread our sleeping bags on the dry floor of the tent

definitions.text: a structure consisting of a room or set of rooms at a single position along a vertical scale
examples: what level is the office on?
the government established a wage floor

definitions.text: the ground on which people and animals move about
examples: the fire spared the forest floor

definitions.text: the bottom surface of any lake or other body of water
the lower inside surface of any hollow structure

examples: the whole floor complained about the lack of heat

definitions.text: the parliamentary right to address an assembly
examples: the chairman granted him the floor

definitions.text: the legislative hall where members debate and vote and conduct other business
examples: there was a motion from the floor

definitions.text: a large room in a exchange where the trading is done
surprise greatly; knock someone's socks off
examples: I was floored when I heard that I was promoted
